title: Who Joins Alibaba, Lululemon On List Of Warren Buffett Stocks To Watch?
summary:
Which companies qualify as potential Warren Buffett stocks?
Several of the best mutual funds have also been investing in these Warren Buffett stocks.
Warren Buffett focuses primarily on fundamentals, while CAN SLIM takes into account both fundamental and technical strength.
This can be a particularly useful rating for investors looking for potential Warren Buffett stocks since it ties in with the Oracle of Omaha's focus on a company's fundamentals.

text:
Which companies qualify as potential Warren Buffett stocks? See which stocks remain after the coronavirus stock market crash and a budding recovery takes hold.

X

Since the Oracle of Omaha has never written a book detailing his investment strategy, there's no definitive buying checklist. But parts of his stock-picking strategy can be gleaned from the annual reports of Berkshire Hathaway (BRKB). The screen below highlights stocks like Lululemon Athletica (VEEV) and Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba (BABA).

Several names on the latest list are basing, in or near new buy zones, or trading around all-time highs. Stocks that have been showing particular strength include Veeva and cloud security firm Qualys (QLYS).

BABA stock and LULU stock are testing or approaching new buy zones. Alibaba gapped up to a nearly 6% gain Monday in strong volume. Lululemon, which was featured in IBD Leaderboard on May 11, jumped to a nearly 4% gain to start off the weak. Meanwhile, hospice and health care provider Amedysis (AMED) spiked more than 4%.

Several of the best mutual funds have also been investing in these Warren Buffett stocks. Over the last three months, 18 of these leading funds invested approximately $148 million in BABA stock. During the same period, 16 funds bought $292 million worth of VEEV stock.

Screening For Warren Buffett Stocks

Created in MarketSmith, the screen below emphasizes metrics when looking for companies with long-term past and potential future growth. To make the list, each stock must meet a wide range of criteria, including:

Top 25% of all stocks in terms of five-year annual EPS growth rate.

Top 15% of all stocks in terms of sustainable growth.

12% or better return on equity.

15% or greater sustainable EPS growth rate.

Create Your Own Custom Stock Screens With MarketSmith

Company Symbol Sustainable Growth % EPS Rating SMR Rating Comp Rating ROE ROE 5-Yr Avg EPS % Growth 5 Yr Pct Rnk United Rentals Inc URI 42 90 A 79 42 39.3 80 Intuit Inc INTU 38 96 A 97 54.3 61.9 78 Lululemon Athletica LULU 38 96 A 96 38 26.5 79 Copart Inc CPRT 32 99 A 96 31.9 30.3 83 Credit Acceptance Corp CACC 30 93 A 66 30.2 30.7 82 Fox Factory Holding Corp FOXF 29 91 A 78 28.6 25.8 84 Medifast Inc MED 27 89 A 88 67.5 46.4 88 Amedisys Inc AMED 26 86 A 94 25.9 19.6 88 Qualys Inc QLYS 26 98 A 98 25.9 18.9 88 Five Below Inc FIVE 24 92 A 90 24.3 21.6 86 Veeva Systems Inc Cl A VEEV 24 99 A 99 23.9 18 92 Autohome Inc Cl A Ads ATHM 22 88 A 92 26.5 24.6 87 Globant SA GLOB 22 97 A 95 22.2 19.4 76 Biospecifics Technologie BSTC 22 93 A 98 22 19.8 83 Alibaba Group Hldg Ads BABA 21 99 A 98 21 25.7 83 Techtarget Inc TTGT 20 92 A 90 19.5 13.6 87 Cintas Corp CTAS 20 97 A 84 27.6 26.7 77 Terex Corp TEX 20 39 C 17 26.1 21.5 77 Oshkosh Corporation OSK 19 65 B 56 22.9 18.1 84 Americas Car-Mart Inc CRMT 19 95 A 69 19.4 15.1 83 Abiomed Inc ABMD 19 92 A 93 18.8 19.2 93 Hailiang Edu Group Ads HLG 19 98 A 88 18.8 19.2 78 Old Dominion Fght Line ODFL 18 78 B 89 21.4 19.2 78 N A P C O Security Tech NSSC 18 96 A 86 18.2 15.5 83 T D Ameritrade Hldg Corp AMTD 18 73 A 68 27.6 21.6 84 Albany Intl Corp Cl A AIN 17 89 B 49 20.4 14.5 79 Medpace Holdings Inc MEDP 17 96 A 98 17.2 13.8 87 Emcor Group Inc EME 16 92 B 54 17.1 15 75 D R Horton Inc DHI 15 98 A 85 17 16 78

Rating Potential Warren Buffett Stocks

The names that qualify as Warren Buffett stocks for the purposes of this screen don't always qualify as CAN SLIM stocks under IBD's rating system.

One performance metric we monitor is the overall Composite Rating, which ranges from 1 (lowest) to 99 (highest). Warren Buffett focuses primarily on fundamentals, while CAN SLIM takes into account both fundamental and technical strength.

The Composite Rating reveals how strongly a company is showing the seven telltale traits of winning stocks. A rating of 95, for example, means the company is outperforming 95% of all other stocks in terms of the most important fundamental and technical stock-picking criteria.

The EPS Rating tracks a company's annual and quarterly earnings growth, then measures how its numbers stack up against those of all other stocks. So just like the Composite Rating, a score of 95 means the company's EPS growth is in the top 5% of all stocks.

The SMR Rating tracks sales growth, profit margins and return on equity as a whole. An A rating means the company is in the top 20% of all stocks in terms of those key fundamental performance metrics. This can be a particularly useful rating for investors looking for potential Warren Buffett stocks since it ties in with the Oracle of Omaha's focus on a company's fundamentals.

Follow Matthew Galgani on Twitter at @IBD_MGalgani.
